page.title: 05INTERESTING BUILDINGS
page.content: Our Doctors' surgery is very interesting. until 1977 it was the village police station. In past years there had been a Petty Session court held there. There were 3 cells a magistrates' room, a witness room and a small ante-room. There were also rooms for the police inspector and constables and a prisoners' exercise yard. In 1979 it was converted into our surgery. It is unusual, as the old court room is now our waiting room and if you need treatment or injections these are given in rooms which were once the cells. The tretment rooms have small barred windows and the ceilings are low & rounded. As we are a country practice we do not have to go to a chemist for our medicines but get them at the surgery dispensary.
